instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
at first, ppbus is 8.2v, green light on charger, so I tried changing isl, still the same
tried reballing smc, same
so I tried replacing smc, now I got 8.6v on ppbus, and orange light on charger, but board still doesnt turn on
before I tried measuring every power rail, I curiously checked ppvrtc at <RESISTOR>R1450</RESISTOR> and found it shorted, so I tried removing all caps and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, but it's still shorted, is it the cpu? or something is just not telling it to turn on or anything ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Which is the exact ohm value to ground there?
If still short without <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and biggest caps, is possible to inject voltage and check if PCH gets hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Sounds like PCH. Sucks sometimes I?ve noticed on these boards when the SMC dies the CPU does as well especially when the SMC shorts 3v42 to ground randomly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
well, my dc power supply always beeping when I inject voltage to shorted circuit..
2 consecutive pch deadend is sapping my energy real quick xD
